intro: Mentha longifolia var. laevigata, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, aromatic leaves with a mild, licorice-like scent. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its roots are often harvested for their aromatic properties and used in culinary and medicinal applications. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
